text: <@UCY83QS6Q> I get the same error. Good to mention that the project is indeed not created in the portal. My goal would be to automatically create the project when running the hs project upload command, any idea if this can be bypassed?

Whats the recommended way of rendering forms within the js-building-blocks. Saw in a previous post its not possible to reconstruct the form passed by formField prop if there was one.

Is the workaround then just to hardcone one and make an ajax call from the client?

I don't have an answer but I'm curious as well. I assume it's:
1. use a regular javascript HubSpot embed script in some way (I guess through a useEffect or whatever the react approach is) 
2. use client side form API (old way): <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/forms/submit_form>
3. use serverless function form API (new way): <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/forms/submit_form_v3_authentication#:~:text=As%20this%20API%20is%20authenticated%2C>
4. any other possible approaches?
Serverless doesnt really work if you dont have CMS enterprise so i guess client side call is what it is
<@U05CAJG8D98> are you planning on using any kind of react helper libraries to make the request? like axios or something to prevent page reload specifically?
Iâ€™ll make a custom form handler to prevent the default and then just use a helper for the ajax call, axios would also work
